events.originalText: Massachusetts became the first U.S. state to legalize same-sex marriage.
events.subtitle: Massachusetts
events.headline: Massachusetts Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage

events.originalText: Following the killing of two English football fans by Galatasaray supporters in the previous month, British and Turkish hooligans rioted on the day of the UEFA Cup Final in Copenhagen, Denmark.
events.subtitle: 2000 UEFA Cup semi-final violence
events.headline: Riots Erupt in Copenhagen After Football Fan Killings

events.originalText: Six-year-old Gedhun Choekyi Nyima, the 11th Panchen Lama selected by the 14th Dalai Lama, was kidnapped by the Chinese government, who advocated a proxy.
events.subtitle: Gedhun Choekyi Nyima
events.headline: Chinese Government Kidnaps Panchen Lama

events.originalText: An Iraqi jet aircraft fired two Exocet missiles at the American frigate USS Stark leaving 37 personnel of the warship dead and 21 others injured.
events.subtitle: USS Stark incident
events.headline: Iraqi Jet Attacks American Frigate, 37 Dead

events.originalText: The Troubles: The Ulster Volunteer Force detonated a series of car bombs in Dublin and Monaghan, Ireland, killing 34 people and injuring almost 300 more.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Ulster Volunteer Force Car Bombs Kill 34 in Dublin and Monaghan

events.originalText: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled in the landmark case Brown v. Board of Education, outlawing racial segregation in public schools because "separate educational facilities are inherently unequal" and therefore unconstitutional.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of the United States
events.headline: U.S. Supreme Court Outlaws Racial Segregation in Schools

events.originalText: After renegotiating a contract with the makers of her signature perfume Chanel No. 5, Coco Chanel (pictured) received a share of wartime profits from its sale, making her one of the richest women in the world.
events.subtitle: Chanel No. 5
events.headline: Coco Chanel Becomes One of the Richest Women

events.originalText: Under the Protocol of Corfu, the Principality of Albania officially recognized Northern Epirus as an autonomous self-governing region.
events.subtitle: Protocol of Corfu
events.headline: Albania Recognizes Northern Epirus as Autonomous Region

events.originalText: The Antikythera mechanism, the oldest known surviving geared mechanism, was discovered among artifacts retrieved from a shipwreck off the Greek island of Antikythera.
events.subtitle: Antikythera mechanism
events.headline: Oldest Gear Mechanism Found in Antikythera Shipwreck

events.originalText: The first copies of the children's novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz by L. Frank Baum were printed.
events.subtitle: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
events.headline: First Copies of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz Printed

events.originalText: The International Telecommunication Union, which standardizes and regulates international radio and telecommunications, was founded as the International Telegraph Union in Paris.
events.subtitle: International Telecommunication Union
events.headline: International Telegraph Union Founded in Paris

events.originalText: American Civil War: at the Battle of Big Black River Bridge in Mississippi, Union forces under John McClernand defeated a Confederate rearguard, capturing around 1,700 men.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Forces Win Battle of Big Black River Bridge

events.originalText: Anne of Denmark (pictured) was crowned queen consort of Scotland in a ceremony at Holyrood Abbey in Edinburgh.
events.subtitle: Anne of Denmark
events.headline: Anne of Denmark Crowned Queen Consort of Scotland

events.originalText: English nobleman Edward Stafford, whose father had been beheaded for rebelling against King Richard III, was himself executed for treason against King Henry VIII.
events.subtitle: Edward Stafford, 3rd Duke of Buckingham
events.headline: Edward Stafford Executed for Treason

events.originalText: An outnumbered Wallachian army repulsed invading Ottoman forces at the Battle of Rovine.
events.subtitle: Wallachia
events.headline: Wallachian Army Repels Ottoman Forces at Battle of Rovine
